channel.title: Kidnapping
channel.description:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kidnapping_of_Colleen_Stan
What should one do if they're caught in a similar situation? Just curious as this I've never seen this discussed past one show I saw on it.

item.title: Kidnapping
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:22, topic:484843”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=603079.msg4223834#msg4223834 date=1360907060]

Yea but if they somehow overwhelmed her or lied to her to convince her to stop she’d be punished to hell

She met regularly with her family. How hard is it to visit family, call 911 and set up a sting type mission with the police to catch the freaks who did it to her? All she would have to do is visit her family call the police, explain the situation, get the police ready to swarm in, call the kidnappers and ask to be picked up, and when they got there just have the police swarm like hell. and take them down.

Call me crazy, but I thought of that in about 30 seconds. She had plenty of situations where she didn’t have to live like that for such a long time.

EDIT: I just read the rest of this, basically Colleen Stan is one of those super Christians with Rose Petal glasses, trying to find the best in everyone. How she could let herself go through all of that and not see how the world really is, is beyond me.

She believed the house was being wiretapped. Like I said, with her kind of personality, if something is forcefully drilled into your head long enough you’ll start to believe it.
[/quote]
Idk… If someone who just ripped me from my entire life and started trying to tell me that a house I had lived in for 20 years was all of a sudden wire tapped I would remain skeptical. Not sure when security cameras that weren’t the size of cinder blocks were created, but she could have easily wrote it on a piece of paper, sent it in the mail, and much more.

Maybe I’m thinking too clearly because I’m not in that situation, I just don’t find myself being that naive. It just feels like everything doesn’t add up to her having to live that kind of life for that long.[/quote]
As stated before, she’s quite naive. We’re talking young innocent girl that accepts rides from strangers, not person who debates on forums and is quite knowledgeable about the modern technology, weapons, etc. Looking at some of the teens from my school, most of them think getting on their friend’s Facebook when they’re not looking is hacking, and thinks that Obama is the anti chirist, I’d say the chances of her being naive enough to believe her situation are quite high.

Read full topic

item.title: Kidnapping
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:21, topic:484843”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=603079.msg4223673#msg4223673 date=1360901152]

Yea but if they somehow overwhelmed her or lied to her to convince her to stop she’d be punished to hell

She met regularly with her family. How hard is it to visit family, call 911 and set up a sting type mission with the police to catch the freaks who did it to her? All she would have to do is visit her family call the police, explain the situation, get the police ready to swarm in, call the kidnappers and ask to be picked up, and when they got there just have the police swarm like hell. and take them down.

Call me crazy, but I thought of that in about 30 seconds. She had plenty of situations where she didn’t have to live like that for such a long time.

EDIT: I just read the rest of this, basically Colleen Stan is one of those super Christians with Rose Petal glasses, trying to find the best in everyone. How she could let herself go through all of that and not see how the world really is, is beyond me.
[/quote]
She believed the house was being wiretapped. Like I said, with her kind of personality, if something is forcefully drilled into your head long enough you’ll start to believe it.[/quote]
Idk… If someone who just ripped me from my entire life and started trying to tell me that a house I had lived in for 20 years was all of a sudden wire tapped I would remain skeptical. Not sure when security cameras that weren’t the size of cinder blocks were created, but she could have easily wrote it on a piece of paper, sent it in the mail, and much more.

Maybe I’m thinking too clearly because I’m not in that situation, I just don’t find myself being that naive. It just feels like everything doesn’t add up to her having to live that kind of life for that long.

Read full topic

Yea but if they somehow overwhelmed her or lied to her to convince her to stop she’d be punished to hell
[/quote]
She met regularly with her family. How hard is it to visit family, call 911 and set up a sting type mission with the police to catch the freaks who did it to her? All she would have to do is visit her family call the police, explain the situation, get the police ready to swarm in, call the kidnappers and ask to be picked up, and when they got there just have the police swarm like hell. and take them down.

Call me crazy, but I thought of that in about 30 seconds. She had plenty of situations where she didn’t have to live like that for such a long time.

EDIT: I just read the rest of this, basically Colleen Stan is one of those super Christians with Rose Petal glasses, trying to find the best in everyone. How she could let herself go through all of that and not see how the world really is, is beyond me.[/quote]
She believed the house was being wiretapped. Like I said, with her kind of personality, if something is forcefully drilled into your head long enough you’ll start to believe it.

item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Frell:

Yea but if they somehow overwhelmed her or lied to her to convince her to stop she’d be punished to hell

She met regularly with her family. How hard is it to visit family, call 911 and set up a sting type mission with the police to catch the freaks who did it to her? All she would have to do is visit her family call the police, explain the situation, get the police ready to swarm in, call the kidnappers and ask to be picked up, and when they got there just have the police swarm like hell. and take them down.

Call me crazy, but I thought of that in about 30 seconds. She had plenty of situations where she didn’t have to live like that for such a long time.

EDIT: I just read the rest of this, basically Colleen Stan is one of those super Christians with Rose Petal glasses, trying to find the best in everyone. How she could let herself go through all of that and not see how the world really is, is beyond me.

item.title: Kidnapping
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:7, topic:484843”]Bondage, best turn on EVER!

I think that this is all fake, i doubt this actually happened the way it was explained. Everything just doesn’t make sense, the way she acted and such. It would have made sense if she had tried to escape but she didn’t so i believe she was their on her own bondage fantasies. Probably found him on creigs list or something.[/quote]
This happened a long time ago, not sure it was even around then.

The only reason I’d believe it is because if you’re naive enough to accept random rides from strangers, you’re likely to believe something that’s drilled into your head after a year or so whilst being tortured.

Read full topic
